Hi,
i would like to check this idea with you guys.
The problem has around 1=
0,000 inputs, and only 3 outputs. So, in order to discover which inputs are=
 more relevant than others, i am thinking of initial state of 0 hidden node=
s and do increases of hidden nodes by 1 and only allow 20% of the best popu=
lation to go for next stage.
For example:
Stage1.1 Start the process with a=
 maximum of 1 hidden nodes (i.e. mutate_add_node() function is not allowed =
to execute if genome has one node already). Randomly connect inputs. Mutate=
 weights. Evolve for a considerable time(still to find out how much).
Stage=
1.2 Remove 80% percent of the population. 
Stage2.1 Start with population t=
hat survived stage 1. Allow genomes to grow during mutation 1 node more (ma=
ximum 2 nodes per network now). Evolve for a considerable time.
Stage2.2 Re=
move 80% percent of the population. 
Stage3.1 Start with population that su=
rvived stage 2. Allow networks to grow 1 node more (maximum 3 nodes per net=
work) ....
And so on... 

As you see, the basic idea, is to limit the growt=
h of depth of the networks, forcing them to first find the best solution at=
 the minimum possible ammount of network depth, before adding more nodes. 
=
There will be no limits on how many links can be created.
Do you think this=
 method will improve the search?
Thanks in advance.
